## Description {#details}

A Load/Store unit class that models load/store queues and that implements a simple weak memory consistency model.

<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#ad3dbe0f5aef201f9769662e1143d4d8e"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#ad3dbe0f5aef201f9769662e1143d4d8e">isLQEmpty</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> !UsedLQEntries; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#ab04ba9f06d2bc74d20c0b3bdb41c0d7e"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#ab04ba9f06d2bc74d20c0b3bdb41c0d7e">isSQFull</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SQSize &amp;&amp; SQSize == UsedSQEntries; &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5b94065d1c6634bea32ff5560ed45c7d"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5b94065d1c6634bea32ff5560ed45c7d">onInstructionExecuted</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>) = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Loads are tracked by the LDQ (load queue) from dispatch until completion.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Stores are tracked by the STQ (store queue) from dispatch until commitment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// By default we conservatively assume that the LDQ receives a load at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dispatch. Loads leave the LDQ at retirement stage.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5b0a4d24a28315948079a27d13a6463a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5b0a4d24a28315948079a27d13a6463a">onInstructionRetired</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>) = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#afa067c3556c68e3b8a3527cf6b88d4e3"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#afa067c3556c68e3b8a3527cf6b88d4e3">onInstructionIssued</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>) = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5efdb8e58c2a8c3c2ff6291ac2706c18"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a5efdb8e58c2a8c3c2ff6291ac2706c18">cycleEvent</a>() = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a05ad2c90a151c8858f7b96e573f93ac1"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">virtual</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#a05ad2c90a151c8858f7b96e573f93ac1">dump</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Default Load/Store Unit (LS Unit) for simulated processors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each load (or store) consumes one entry in the load (or store) queue.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Rules are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1) A younger load is allowed to pass an older load only if there are no</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    stores nor barriers in between the two loads.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 2) An younger store is not allowed to pass an older store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 3) A younger store is not allowed to pass an older load.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 4) A younger load is allowed to pass an older store only if the load does</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    not alias with the store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This class optimistically assumes that loads don&#39;t alias store operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Under this assumption, younger loads are always allowed to pass older</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// stores (this would only affects rule 4).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Essentially, this class doesn&#39;t perform any sort alias analysis to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// identify aliasing loads and stores.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To enforce aliasing between loads and stores, flag &#96;AssumeNoAlias&#96; must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// set to &#96;false&#96; by the constructor of LSUnit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that this class doesn&#39;t know about the existence of different memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// types for memory operations (example: write-through, write-combining, etc.).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Derived classes are responsible for implementing that extra knowledge, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// provide different sets of rules for loads and stores by overriding method</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#96;isReady()&#96;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To emulate a write-combining memory type, rule 2 must be relaxed in a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// derived class to enable the reordering of non-aliasing store operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// No assumptions are made by this class on the size of the store buffer.  This</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// class doesn&#39;t know how to identify cases where store-to-load forwarding may</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// occur.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LSUnit doesn&#39;t attempt to predict whether a load or store hits or misses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the L1 cache. To be more specific, LSUnit doesn&#39;t know anything about</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cache hierarchy and memory types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// It only knows if an instruction &quot;mayLoad&quot; and/or &quot;mayStore&quot;. For loads, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// scheduling model provides an &quot;optimistic&quot; load-to-use latency (which usually</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// matches the load-to-use latency for when there is a hit in the L1D).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Derived classes may expand this knowledge.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Class MCInstrDesc in LLVM doesn&#39;t know about serializing operations, nor</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory-barrier like instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LSUnit conservatively assumes that an instruction which &#96;mayLoad&#96; and has</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#96;unmodeled side effects&#96; behave like a &quot;soft&quot; load-barrier. That means, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// serializes loads without forcing a flush of the load queue.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Similarly, instructions that both &#96;mayStore&#96; and have &#96;unmodeled side</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// effects&#96; are treated like store barriers. A full memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// barrier is a &#39;mayLoad&#39; and &#39;mayStore&#39; instruction with unmodeled side</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// effects. This is obviously inaccurate, but this is the best that we can do</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// at the moment.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Each load/store barrier consumes one entry in the load/store queue. A</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// load/store barrier enforces ordering of loads/stores:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  - A younger load cannot pass a load barrier.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  - A younger store cannot pass a store barrier.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A younger load has to wait for the memory load barrier to execute.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A load/store barrier is &quot;executed&quot; when it becomes the oldest entry in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the load/store queue(s). That also means, all the older loads/stores have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// already been executed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/#afc6d000df5b9e7f37f240a2dea8eb807">LSUnit</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunitbase/#ae26462941069e163c658782b4132b79d">LSUnitBase</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This class doesn&#39;t know about the latency of a load instruction. So, it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conservatively/pessimistically assumes that the latency of a load opcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// matches the instruction latency.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: In the absence of cache misses (i.e. L1I/L1D/iTLB/dTLB hits/misses),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and load/store conflicts, the latency of a load is determined by the depth</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the load pipeline. So, we could use field &#96;LoadLatency&#96; in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// MCSchedModel to model that latency.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Field &#96;LoadLatency&#96; often matches the so-called &#39;load-to-use&#39; latency from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// L1D, and it usually already accounts for any extra latency due to data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// forwarding.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When doing throughput analysis, &#96;LoadLatency&#96; is likely to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be a better predictor of load latency than instruction latency. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// particularly true when simulating code with temporal/spatial locality of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// memory accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Using &#96;LoadLatency&#96; (instead of the instruction latency) is also expected</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to improve the load queue allocation for long latency instructions with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// folded memory operands (See PR39829).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: On some processors, load/store operations are split into multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// uOps. For example, X86 AMD Jaguar natively supports 128-bit data types, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// not 256-bit data types. So, a 256-bit load is effectively split into two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 128-bit loads, and each split load consumes one &#39;LoadQueue&#39; entry. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// simplicity, this class optimistically assumes that a load instruction only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// consumes one entry in the LoadQueue.  Similarly, store instructions only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// consume a single entry in the StoreQueue.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In future, we should reassess the quality of this design, and consider</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// alternative approaches that let instructions specify the number of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// load/store queue entries which they consume at dispatch stage (See</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PR39830).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An instruction that both &#39;mayStore&#39; and &#39;HasUnmodeledSideEffects&#39; is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conservatively treated as a store barrier. It forces older store to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// executed before newer stores are issued.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An instruction that both &#39;MayLoad&#39; and &#39;HasUnmodeledSideEffects&#39; is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conservatively treated as a load barrier. It forces older loads to execute</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// before newer loads are issued.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A node of a memory dependency graph. A MemoryGroup describes a set of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// instructions with same memory dependencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// By construction, instructions of a MemoryGroup don&#39;t depend on each other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// At dispatch stage, instructions are mapped by the LSUnit to MemoryGroups.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A Memory group identifier is then stored as a &quot;token&quot; in field</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Instruction::LSUTokenID of each dispatched instructions. That token is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// used internally by the LSUnit to track memory dependencies.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight">MemoryGroup &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumPredecessors = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecutingPredecessors = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecutedPredecessors = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumInstructions = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecuting = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecuted = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Successors that are in a order dependency with this group.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MemoryGroup &#42;, 4&gt;</a> OrderSucc;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Successors that are in a data dependency with this group.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;MemoryGroup &#42;, 4&gt;</a> DataSucc;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> CriticalMemoryInstruction;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#ae1012a13e71584473f2c88297555bd0c">MemoryGroup</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MemoryGroup &amp;) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">    MemoryGroup &amp;operator=(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MemoryGroup &amp;) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#ae1012a13e71584473f2c88297555bd0c"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#ae1012a13e71584473f2c88297555bd0c">MemoryGroup</a>() = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#ab16c9ca1a04f5acab8b1ca20ded3712d"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#ab16c9ca1a04f5acab8b1ca20ded3712d">MemoryGroup</a>(MemoryGroup &amp;&amp;) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">default</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#aba9478071acc2dc40303b34f5ef3bb7f"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#aba9478071acc2dc40303b34f5ef3bb7f">getNumSuccessors</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#af0a3d89610eab922cbcca08d55eb2e72"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#af0a3d89610eab922cbcca08d55eb2e72">getCriticalMemoryInstruction</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a709c6dc8cffce8d451fd85145e9da4dd"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mca/criticaldependency">CriticalDependency</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a709c6dc8cffce8d451fd85145e9da4dd">getCriticalPredecessor</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CriticalPredecessor;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a755908a8693ddcd0451b4da97011003e"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a755908a8693ddcd0451b4da97011003e">addSuccessor</a>(MemoryGroup &#42;Group, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsDataDependent) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Do not need to add a dependency if there is no data</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dependency and all instructions from this group have been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// issued already.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!IsDataDependent &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a6f4c4262f3b956a810436935f5431b37">isExecuting</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><span class="doxyHighlight">      Group-&gt;NumPredecessors++;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a4344aa0bc7f819f655d89d8095627681">isExecuted</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Should have been removed!&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a6f4c4262f3b956a810436935f5431b37">isExecuting</a>())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">        Group-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a2ed5eda3550114a31e99d480c045bfc2">onGroupIssued</a>(CriticalMemoryInstruction, IsDataDependent);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (IsDataDependent)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlight">        DataSucc.emplace&#95;back(Group);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlight">        OrderSucc.emplace&#95;back(Group);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a9276f1f6ccebe58ce0f81b11b3e872bb"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a9276f1f6ccebe58ce0f81b11b3e872bb">isWaiting</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumPredecessors &gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlight">             (NumExecutingPredecessors + NumExecutedPredecessors);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a7472cedbaadb18cf0e30121f329d0b73"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a7472cedbaadb18cf0e30121f329d0b73">isPending</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecutingPredecessors &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">             ((NumExecutedPredecessors + NumExecutingPredecessors) ==</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">              NumPredecessors);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#aa5eb95bbc456dfc770ca1ddfe91b63f2"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#aa5eb95bbc456dfc770ca1ddfe91b63f2">isReady</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecutedPredecessors == NumPredecessors; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a6f4c4262f3b956a810436935f5431b37"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a6f4c4262f3b956a810436935f5431b37">isExecuting</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumExecuting &amp;&amp; (NumExecuting == (NumInstructions - NumExecuted));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a4344aa0bc7f819f655d89d8095627681"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/memorygroup/#a4344aa0bc7f819f655d89d8095627681">isExecuted</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NumInstructions == NumExecuted; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Allocates LS resources for instruction IR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method assumes that a previous call to &#96;isAvailable(IR)&#96; succeeded</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returning LSU&#95;AVAILABLE.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Rules are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// By default, rules are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 1 A store may not pass a previous store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 2 A load may not pass a previous store unless flag &#39;NoAlias&#39; is set.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 3 A load may pass a previous load.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 4 A store may not pass a previous load (regardless of flag &#39;NoAlias&#39;).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 5 A load has to wait until an older load barrier is fully executed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// 6 A store has to wait until an older store barrier is fully executed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit/#ac6a40d1885d6a63e525caab19137600d">dispatch</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"></CodeLine>
